runs.comm: fullish outside off, comes to him slower than he would like, and he drives straighter than he intends, to the fielder at short extra cover
back of a length, close to off stump, poked gently into the covers and Dhawan calls his partner through for the single as soon as he makes contact
length ball outside off, left alone

length ball, nips in a touch from outside off to hit Rohit's front pad. Mathews got him out this way a couple of times during the Test series in Sri Lanka last year, but Rohit got an inside edge on it as he looked to play around his front pad
back of a length, a bit of width, and Rohit puts it away, full follow-through of the bat, finishing above his left shoulder, as he slaps it away in front of point
back of a length, angling into middle and leg, tucked away to long leg
length ball outside off, a bit of seam away, and he beats the outside edge as Rohit comes forward and pushes at it, away from his body, looking for a push through cover point
back of a length on off stump, defended back to the bowler
back of a length close to off stump, defended to short cover
a touch fuller, a touch straighter, and Rohit punishes it. Just clears his front leg and swings through the line, one nice fluid swing, and launches it high over mid-on
back of a length, angling into middle and leg, tucked through backward square leg

got him, excellent delivery. Slanting across into the corridor, the length is just right, and Dhawan is late getting forward to push into the covers, his front foot is still landing on its heel when the ball kisses his outside edge through to the keeper

ooh, nearly. This is a length ball angling into off stump, and it stops on Rohit just a touch as he looks to use his wrists and clip towards mid-on. Ends up playing way out in front of his body, and chips it in the air, but it bounces just short of the diving mid-on fielder, sneaks under him, and runs away, all the way to the boundary

length ball close to off stump, Rohit looks to place his front leg inside the line and drive into the covers, but the length and inward angle force him to play it back to the bowler, off the inside half of his bat
shortish, angling into the batsman, worked off the hip to long leg
fullish outside off, gets forward for a punchy drive to mid-off. Looked like this one also stopped on the batsman a little, and he had to check his shot at the last moment
length ball on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
length ball close to off stump, defended back to the bowler
fullish outside off, doesn't come on for the drive. Rohit plays a checked push to mid-off

got him! Beautiful length, and he shifted his line slightly wider to entice the drive away from the body. Goes for the drive on the up, it seams away slightly - just about straightens - and the nick is pouched nicely by Kapugedera at slip, with two hands, a couple of inches above the ground
length ball on off stump, Raina blocks towards mid-off

ooh, nearly through him. This is a length ball that straightens in towards off stump. Raina goes for a big drive, way out in front of his front leg, which hasn't come too far forward, and leaves a big gap. Lucky to get an inside-edge into his pads
ouch. Another tricky delivery, straightens into Raina with extra bounce, and this time it hits him on the back thigh
full on middle and leg, clipped in the air, but into the gap to the left of midwicket
back of a length, angling into off stump, whipped to midwicket

length ball angling into off stump, and this time Kohli's flick is inch-perfect, into the gap to the right of midwicket, and timed so well that long leg has no way of running around and cutting it off
length ball on off stump, gets a big stride out to drive to mid-on
back of a length, shifts his line slightly wide of off. Kohli opens his bat face and guides it down to third man
digs it in, angling across the left-hander. He thought about pulling, realised he would have to drag it from a long way outside off, and left it alone in the end

length ball on middle and off, Raina pushes at it in front of his body, and pops it in the air momentarily. The bowler couldn't reach out far enough to his left to catch that, and it bounces down to mid-on
length ball wide of off, Kohli reaches out to drive and slices it squarer than he wanted, in the air over the leaping point fielder
length ball outside off, presses a long way forward to punch to mid-off
back of a length, angling in towards off stump. Steps across to work it wide of midwicket

on the pads, and Raina whips it away in the air, bounces down to the right of long leg. Didn't quite time it as well as he wiould have liked. Chameera makes a clumsy effort to stop it at the boundary, but managed to not touch the ball while touching the rope
short now, Raina plays a controlled pull from outside off to deep square leg
length ball wide of off, and that is vintage Kohli, bringing his wrists into that whippy drive of his to drill it to the right of point
length ball wide of off, and Raina leans over it to ease it to sweeper cover
length ball, straightens on an off-stump line, opens Kohli up as he shapes to whip through midwicket. Has to check himself and defend into the covers instead
back of a length on off stump, whipped away to deep square leg
back of a length outside off, chopped down to the right of short cover and that's quick, decisive calling and response to run the single
back of a length outside off, rolls his wrists over at the top of the bounce to steer down to third man
back of a length outside off, dabbed to third man
and immediately he beats the edge. Poor footwork from Raina, pressing forward to a shortish ball angling across him, and opens his bat face to try and dab it to third man
back of a length on middle stump, a bit of extra bounce. Raina gets on his toes and works it away through backward square leg
fullish outside off, and wow, what a sound the bat made as it punched that ball between short cover and mid-off. Just showed it the full face, barely any follow-through, just punched through the line
shortish, close to off stump, lets it come on, meets it under his eyes, dabs to third man
short down the leg side, steps across and pulls to long leg
short on middle stump, steps across it and plays a controlled swat-pull down to long leg
back of a length, whipped from just outside off stump, into the gap to the right of midwicket
back of a length on off stump, uses his wrists well to clip that wide of midwicket
length ball wide of off, reaches out to push to sweeper cover
shortish on off stump, lets it come on and rides the bounce to work it away to deep square leg
fullish, close to off, shows the full face and drives it back down the ground, between the stumps and the non-striker
back of a length on off stump, and again that's excellent use of the wrists. Lets it come to him and works it away to deep square leg
back of a length, angling across the left-hander. Raina steps back and a long way across to work it from just outside off, through midwicket
short outside off, and he punches that hard into the ground, and it bounces up over the leaping point fielder
back of a length close to off stump, punched to the left of mid-off
dug in short outside leg, Raina steps across and leaves it alone

length ball on off stump, and that's a beautiful shot. Gets his head over the ball and whips it away to the left of mid-on. Deep square leg chases hard to his right, but it was timed so well it gave him no chance of stopping that
quick bouncer over middle stump. Raina ducks quickly under it
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-off
back of a length on off stump, no turn. Raina shapes to whip into the leg side, has to punch back to the bowler instead
fuller, driven to long-on
tossed up on middle and leg, steps inside the line to drive to long-off
full on leg stump, clipped to deep square leg
length ball on middle stump, goes deep in his crease and punches to midwicket

length ball on middle and leg, and Shanaka has struck first ball! Looks to step inside the line and hit over mid-off, the ball is a little shorter than he thought, and it hits high on the bat and loops high in the air, and is caught on the juggle by mid-off
very full outside off, meets it with the full face, angled just so, to push to sweeper cover
full on off stump, driven to mid-on
shortish, angling away and offering a lot of width. Yuvraj chases it and slashes it away over backward point
shortish on off stump, pulled round to long leg
full outside off, Kohli steps out to it and drives to sweeper cover

goes back to a fairly full ball on middle stump, quicker than normal, and looks to whip through the leg side. The ball pitches just a touch shorter than he thinks and he pokes it back to the bowler, off the outside part of his bat, nearly the leading edge
back of a length close to off, punched to sweeper cover
fullish on off stump, clipped to long-on
tossed up full on leg stump, and Kohli keeps his front pad out of the way to drive inside-out to long-off

down the track now, doesn't quite reach the pitch of this off-stump ball, but he doesn't care. Just goes through with the shot, hard over the bowler's head, and long-on has no chance even though he barely has any distance to cover to his right
full on leg stump and that is punished. Just whips it away, with the turn, and sends it soaring over the midwicket boundary
fullish on middle stump, this is the slower ball. Kohli has to adjust to the lack of pace before he can clip to long-on
bouncer outside leg, Yuvraj thinks of pulling and decides to leave instead. That could have been called wide for both height and line
length ball wide of off, and Yuvraj just stands tall and slaps it away, on the up to sweeper cover
slower ball outside off, gets his head over it and dabs to third man
back of a length, angling across Yuvraj. His back foot didn't really go across to that, and it slipped past his edge as he tried to run it down to third man
length ball wide of off, and the angle defeats Yuvraj's edge as he throws his hands at an airy drive away from his body
back of a length on off stump, straigtens a touch to cramp Yuvraj, who jams his bat down from that high backlift to jab it down into the pitch
back of a length close to off stump, dabbed gently towards backward point
short outside off, and that may have stopped on Yuvraj a little. Looks to pull, and inside-edges thickly into his back pad
length ball on middle and leg, and Yuvraj steps away from leg stump and slices under the ball to lift that high over cover point
short, just outside off, pulls from shoulder height, and he can't keep it down. Jayasuriya dives forward and to his left at deep square leg, and the ball drops inches short of his hands
length ball close to off stump, stabbed to backward point
down the track and Perera shortens his length outside off, Kohli slaps it away to deep point
slower ball outside off, gets on the front foot and pushes gently towards point
back of a length outside off, dabbed to third man
back of a length on middle stump, whipped away to deep square leg
back of a length outside off, punched towards sweeper cover
shortish on middle and leg, that didn't climb as much as Yuvraj expected. He drags his pull down off the inside half of his bat, gets it into the gap to the left of long leg
short, angling away from off stump. Yuvraj doesn't connect with the pull
shortish outside off, and Kohli loses his 100% control. Not sure if it kept a little low, but he inside-edged his pull down past his off stump to the fine leg boundary
jumps down the track, making room to hit inside-out. The ball isn't quite full enough, on off stump, and he drags it to mid-on off the inside half of his bat
full and wide, slapped to deep point
shot! That's right in Yuvraj's slot, full, giving him swinging room outside off, and he swings freely through the line to lift it over the wide mid-off region
digs it in short now, and that's a well-directed bouncer. Yuvraj takes his eye off the ball a little while swiveling to hook, and top-edges to the man at fine leg
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover
tossed up on leg stump, steps down the track, gets inside the line, and drives with a straight bat to long-off
flighted ball on off and middle, driven to short extra cover
lovely flight on middle and leg. Pandya is opened up a little, looks to drive to long-on, ends up driving back to the bowler
down the track now and Herath holds his length back slightly. Goes over the top, chips into the gap between sweeper cover and long-off

bowled him! Herath has just worked Pandya over here. Bowled it much quicker, on a good length, and got it to straighten. Pandya's front shoulder opens up again as he looks to whip across the line, and the ball beats his outside edge and pegs back off stump
quickish and flat on off stump, Dhoni stretches out to block it
length ball angling into middle stump, clipped away through midwicket
tossed up close to off stump, Dhoni plays a whippy drive to short cover
down the track, and Dhoni just dismisses that from his presence. Reaches the pitch of this off stump ball and whips his wrists through the line to launch it straight back over the bowler's head

length ball on middle stump, and that's the other side of Dhoni. Presses forward, just puts his bat in the ball's path, with a slightly closed face, and dabs gently into the midwicket region for a quick single
down the track, and Kohli gets to fifty with a super shot. Flat-bats this wide-ish length ball cleanly over the covers
down the track and this time Siriwardana fires it in full and straight, clipped to long-on
down the track, and he can't force this whippy drive past the packed cover field
down the track again, and this time the line is straighter. Kohli just whips it away over midwicket one bounce and over the rope, and he's piloted India home with a supremely controlled innings
